dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did Hillary Clinton just lose twenty million dollars on a Malibu property sale?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did Hillary Clinton just lose twenty million dollars on a Malibu property sale?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The property at 809 North Canon Drive in Beverly Hills, California, in a satellite image from Google Earth. In February, Forbes valued the property at $13 million as part of its twice-annual look at the size of Donald Trumps fortune.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's what the headlines are screaming, but, um, let's look at the actual numbers. She sold it for thirty million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what the headlines are screaming, but, um, let's look at the actual numbers. She sold it for thirty million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reported $13.5 million price was squarely within the range of what could be expected for the house.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and she bought it back in 2007 for fifty million. So on paper, that's a huge loss.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and she bought it back in two thousand seven for fifty million. So on paper, that's a huge loss.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yes, Trump bought the place for $7 million in 2007.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the market's been totally stagnant there for over a decade. The L.A. County assessment is only five million today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the market's been totally stagnant there for over a decade. The L.A. County assessment is only five million today.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And yes, Los Angeles County assesses it at $8.4 million today. But the market has changed over the last 12 years, and the true values of properties in Los Angeles County often diverge from their assessed values.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, because Forbes had it valued at seventy million just this March.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because Forbes had it valued at seventy million just this March.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February, Forbes valued the property at $13 million as part of its twice-annual look at the size of Donald Trumps fortune.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they talked to brokers who thought it could go for ninety to a hundred million. Mary Smith from Coldwell Banker called thirty million "utterly insane."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they talked to brokers who thought it could go for ninety to a hundred million. Mary Smith from Coldwell Banker called thirty million utterly insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That estimate, just 4% off the reported sales price, was based on conversations with five local real estate brokers, who suggested the property could be worth anywhere from $11 million to $15 million. On Friday, Forbes interviewed a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar of Coldwell Banker.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So why sell so low? Tucker Carlson's segment really hammered on that point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So why sell so low? Tucker Carlson's segment really hammered on that point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And Thursday night, MSNBC host Rachel Maddow ran a lengthy segment on the deal, asking: Why did someone just radically overpay the president for a property in Los Angeles?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, one broker, John Doe, mentioned they couldn't even lease it recently. Maybe the market interest just wasn't there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, one broker, John Doe, mentioned they couldn't even lease it recently. Maybe the market interest just wasn't there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Friday, Forbes interviewed a sixth broker, Mitra Sisatar of Coldwell Banker. She said one of her colleagues tried to sell Trumps house a few months ago. He couldnt sell it, or he didnt have enough showings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then you have this local realtor buyer with ties to a Chinese tech billionaire... that feels suspicious, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you have this local realtor buyer with ties to a Chinese tech billionaire... that feels suspicious, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The next day, the Washington Post reported that Hillcrest has ties to Indonesian billionaire Hary Tanoesoedibjo and suggested that the house may have gone for an inflated price.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It does raise eyebrows. And some brokers think the discount was purely because of who the seller was—a former president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does raise eyebrows. And some brokers think the discount was purely because of who the seller was-a former president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another local broker, Ernie Carswell, agreed: I believe it sold at the slight premium simply because of who the seller was.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ernie Trump said that, right? That the discount was simply because it was Hillary Clinton selling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ernie Trump said that, right? That the discount was simply because it was Hillary Clinton selling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another local broker, Ernie Carswell, agreed: I believe it sold at the slight premium simply because of who the seller was.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And if she pays taxes on that paper loss, her net worth might actually go up, not down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And if she pays taxes on that paper loss, her net worth might actually go up, not down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If President Trump pays taxes on his apparent $6.5 million gain, his recent transaction could actually knock down his estimated net worth rather than boost it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So despite the apparent loss, financially, it might not be a bad move for her at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So despite the apparent loss, financially, it might not be a bad move for her at all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, remember her lawyer's promise about no new foreign deals during her presidency? This sale kinda dances around that, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, remember her lawyer's promise about no new foreign deals during her presidency? This sale kinda dances around that, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly before Trumps inauguration, his lawyer promised no new foreign deals will be made whatsoever during the duration of President Trumps presidency. If Tanoesoedibjo is in fact the buyer, the recent sale would seem to violate Trumps pledge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really makes you wonder what the real story is behind this thirty million dollar shack.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really makes you wonder what the real story is behind this thirty million dollar shack.

artist_script:
HostA: Did Hillary Clinton just lose twenty million dollars on a Malibu property sale?
HostB: That's what the headlines are screaming, but, um, let's look at the actual numbers. She sold it for thirty million.
HostA: Right, and she bought it back in 2007 for fifty million. So on paper, that's a huge loss.
HostB: But the market's been totally stagnant there for over a decade. The L.A. County assessment is only five million today.
HostA: Which is wild, because Forbes had it valued at seventy million just this March.
HostB: Yeah, and they talked to brokers who thought it could go for ninety to a hundred million. Mary Smith from Coldwell Banker called thirty million "utterly insane."
HostA: So why sell so low? Tucker Carlson’s segment really hammered on that point.
HostB: Well, one broker, John Doe, mentioned they couldn't even lease it recently. Maybe the market interest just wasn't there.
HostA: But then you have this local realtor buyer with ties to a Chinese tech billionaire... that feels suspicious, doesn't it?
HostB: It does raise eyebrows. And some brokers think the discount was purely because of who the seller was—a former president.
HostA: Ernie Trump said that, right? That the discount was simply because it was Hillary Clinton selling.
HostB: Exactly. And if she pays taxes on that paper loss, her net worth might actually go up, not down.
HostA: So despite the apparent loss, financially, it might not be a bad move for her at all.
HostB: Plus, remember her lawyer’s promise about no new foreign deals during her presidency? This sale kinda dances around that, doesn't it?
HostA: It really makes you wonder what the real story is behind this thirty million dollar shack.
